column3:
FES based Rehabilitation of the Upper Limb using Input/Output
Linearization and ILC
column4: Chris Freeman, Daisy Tong, Katie Meadmore, Ann-Marie Hughes, Eric Rogers and Jane Burridge
column9: RETRACTED ARTICLE: Cascade controller design and stability analysis in FES-aided upper arm stroke rehabilitation robotic system
column10: Wenkang Xu, Chenxiao Cai, Yun Zou
column15:
Highly similar mathematics over an entire section (approx. 4 pages). 
Contains: 
- Identical formulae 
- Near identical formulae with renamed identifiers 
- Use of equivalent notation, partially rather complex and not easy to determine 
- Split-up formulae, partially using equivalent notation

column3: A better asymptotic profile of Rosenau–Burgers equation
column5: Applied Mathematics and Computation, vol. 131, iss. 10, pp. 147-170
column9: Decay of Solutions of Some Nonlinear Equations
column15:
Highly similar mathematics throughout the entire document.
Contains: 
- Identical formulae 
- Near identical formulae with renamed identifiers 
- Near identical formulae with inserted variables, e.g., a+b=c, whereas b = x+y ? a+x+y=c 
- Use of equivalent notation, partially rather complex and not easy to determine 
- Switch from inline formulae in the source document to block formulae in the retracted paper 
- Use of different brackets, ( -> [, small { -> large { - (...)^-4 -> 1/(...)^4 
- Some intermediate formulae from the source document are missing in the retracted document (interesting pattern: often just every second formula is missing!)

column5: Acta Academiae Paedagogicae Agriensis, Sectio Mathematicae, vol. 27, pp. 25-38
column11: Elemente der Mathematik, vol 56, iss. 4, pp 143-146
column15:
Highly similar mathematics throughout the entire document. 
Contains:
- Identical formulae 
- Near identical formulae with renamed identifiers
- Switch from inline formulae in the source document to block formulae in the retracted paper

column3: Polymer translocation through a long nanopore
column4: Elena Slonkina and Anatoly B. Kolomeisky
column5: The Journal of Chemical Physics, vol. 118, iss. 15
column9: RETRACTED: Velocity of polymer translocation through a pore
column10: Ding Kejian, Zhan Furu, Cai Dongqin, Yu Zengliang
column11: Biochemical and Biophysical Research Communications, vol. 341, iss. 1, pp. 139-142
column15:
Reuse of an entire model, which is at the core of the paper. 
- Identifiers partially differ in the source document and the retracted paper. 
- Sometimes, multiple formulae in the source document are merged into one formula in the retracted paper, but the sequence of formulae is nearly identical.

column3: Sensor Network Calculus – A Framework for Worst Case Analysis
column5: Distributed Computing in Sensor Systems. DCOSS 2005. Lecture Notes in Computer Science, vol. 3560, pp. 141-154
column9: RETRACTED: Worst case dimensioning and modeling of reliable real-time multihop wireless sensor network
column10: Kambiz Mizanian, Hamed Yousefi, Amir Hossein Jahangir
column15:
Highly similar mathematics, but also much new content.
Contains:
- Identical formulae
- Identical formulae with added parameter to the declared function, which also caused addition of higher-level parentheses 
- Change of formula order 
- Use of different character to denote product operation

column3: Invariance analysis of improved Zernike moments
column5: Journal of Optics A: Pure and Applied Optics, vol. 4, iss. 6, pp. 606-614
column9: RETRACTED: Invariance image analysis using modified Zernike moments
column10: N.K. Kamila, S. Mahapatra, S. Nanda
column11: Pattern Recognition Letters, vol. 26, iss. 6, pp. 747-753
column15:
Clear reuse of content, not only math, but also text Contains:
- Identical formulae 
- Near identical formulae with renamed identifiers
- Split-up formulae
- Integral range defined as new formula, while in the source document the range is inline

column3: A new Kernelized hybrid c-mean clustering model with optimized parameters
column5: Applied Soft Computing, vol. 10, iss. 2, pp. 381-389
column9: RETRACTED: A robust kernelized intuitionistic fuzzy c-means clustering algorithm in segmentation of noisy medical images
column10: Prabhjot Kaur, A.K. Soni, Anjana Gosain
column11: Pattern Recognition Letters, vol. 34, iss. 2, pp. 163-175
column15:
Very interesting case. The paper references two sources for the math. Content apart from the formulae is clearly reused inappropriately, however, regarding the math, there is a kind of contribution. The used formulae are substantially altered.
Contains:
- Identical formulae
- Similar formula structure like the source papers, but some components are different beyond simple formula editing.

column3: Numerical solution of a nonlinear advance-delay-differential equation from nerve conduction theory
column4: Henjin Chi, Jonathan Bell, Brian Hassard
column5: Journal of Mathematical Biology,vol. 24, iss. 5, pp 583-601
column9: RETRACTED: Numerical treatment of nonlinear mixed delay differential equations
column11:
Applied Mathematical Modelling,
vol. 29, iss. 5, pp. 439-460
column15:
Some equations correspond to the source document. 
- Similar equations are nearly identical to the source document, found only one instance of differing function names and some formatting differences, mostly \frac{}{} vs. ()/() 
- Identical order of formulae as the source document, but many equations are also not from the source document. Only certain chunks of equations match those in the source document.

column3: Robust H? observer design of linear time-delay systems with parametric uncertainty
column4: Zidong Wanga, Biao Huang, H. Unbehauen
column5: Systems & Control Letters, vol. 42, iss. 4, pp. 303-312
column9: RETRACTED: Observer-based passive control of linear time-delay systems with parametric uncertainty
column11: Chaos, Solitons & Fractals, vol. 32, iss. 1, pp. 160-167
column15:
Highly similar mathematics to the source document at multiple positions in the document. 
- Some equations contain additional variables, e.g., a 2D vector in the source document corresponds to a 3D vector in the retracted paper by splitting a variable C into two variables C1 and C2 
- Some equations do not occur in the source document, e.g., p4 or they are heavily modified. Some of the variables in those equations are defined in the same order, but the equations are mostly different. 
- Some equations are expanded compared to the source, e.g., a(b+c) -> ab+ac 
- The numerical example in the retacted paper uses the same equations and values as the source document

column3:
A simple analytical EAM model for bcc metals including Cr
and its application
column4: Ouyang Yifang, Zhang Bangwei, Liao Shuzhi, Jin Zhanpeng
column5: Zeitschrift für Physik B Condensed Matter, vol. 101, iss. 2, pp. 161-168
column9: RETRACTED: A simple analytical EAM model for some bcc metals
column10: Ibrahim H. Dursun, Ziya B. Güvenç, E. Kasap
column11: Communications in Nonlinear Science and Numerical Simulation, vol. 15, iss. 5, pp. 1259-1266
column15:
- Almost all equations correspond to equations in the source document
- Similar equations are in the same order and derivational steps are identical. 
- Sometimes use of slightly different notation than the source, e.g., j (!= i) becomes j != i 
- Formatting of equations sometimes differs slightly, e.g., different line breaks
 - Two tables are exactly alike (contain the same values) 
- One table exhibits a different order of columns and rows than the source document
